divs: Sighting DetailsI was walking in my neighborhood in the evening around the beginning of twilight, when in my peripheral vision to the right I saw light which I first thought must be a comet because there was no sound at all. It came immediately into my view and was very close, about twice as high as a tall palm tree. The shape was elonagated and there were colors swirling around the front in the direction it was traveling, which was south. Then suddenly it disappeared and and I was left with a quiet twilight evening, a couple of stars just beginning to come out. I had no feelings or reactions because it wasn't there long enough for me to react. I was just very disappointed afterwards that it didn't stay longer and that no-one was with me to share the experience.
trends: There have been 173 other sightings in Tucson
There were no other sightings in Tucson on or around September 20th 2005
Summary: Elongated shape, very close....not very high, colors swirling around the front, completely silent.
